parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking electoral spending and are mandated for political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to "parlamentarii maramureșeni" (Maramureș MPs) and implicitly promotes Brian Cristian, who is identified as a Maramureș deputy and vice-president of the Youth and Sports Committee. While not explicitly naming him as a candidate for the upcoming parliamentary elections, the context strongly implies it.  The phrase "Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" (Choose people who work for you) is a clear call to action related to the election.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience.  The message is not a private communication but aims to reach a large number of people in Maramureș County, as evidenced by the location targeting data in the `aaa_info` section.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to influence voters in Maramureș to choose Brian Cristian (implicitly) in the upcoming parliamentary elections. The message highlights his work in parliament and encourages voters to support candidates who work for them. This directly aims to increase his electoral support.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not adhere to journalistic standards. While it mentions parliamentary activity, it lacks objectivity and presents a biased, self-serving narrative to promote Brian Cristian. It's not an informative piece but rather a promotional one.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to sway public opinion in favor of Brian Cristian. The use of a paid advertisement on a public platform further reinforces this intention.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>889472632963010</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a candidate (implicitly Brian Cristian), is used during the electoral period (although the exact end date is not specified, the context suggests it's within the electoral period), has a clear electoral objective (increasing votes for Brian Cristian), and goes beyond journalistic reporting by presenting a biased and promotional message. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as electoral propaganda.  The paid nature of the Facebook post and its targeting of a specific geographical area (Maramureș County) strengthens the case for it being electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 889472632963010) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează implicit candidatura lui Brian Cristian la alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, care conține numărul CMF 11240015, prezintă o imagine favorabilă a activității sale parlamentare și îndeamnă alegătorii să îl voteze, folosind fraze precum „Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi”.  Acest lucru constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.  Având în vedere cheltuielile estimate între 500 și 599 RON și o estimare a audienței de 100.000 - 500.000 persoane, impactul electoral este semnificativ.  Contactul USR Maramureș este maramures@usrmm.ro și +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
